title: Junior .NET Developer Technical Assessment
description: 50 technical interview questions for Junior .NET Developer position

questions.question: What will be the output of the following code?
Which keyword is used to prevent a class from being inherited in C#?
What is the default value of a bool variable in C#?
Which of the following is a value type in C#?
What does the 'var' keyword do in C#?
options: Creates a variable with implicit typing determined at compile time
Creates a variable that can hold any type

questions.question: Which OOP principle allows a child class to provide a specific implementation of a method already defined in its parent class?
What is the difference between 'override' and 'new' keywords when used with methods in C#?
options: 'override' replaces the base method, 'new' hides it
'new' replaces the base method, 'override' hides it
'override' is for abstract methods only, 'new' is for virtual methods

questions.question: What will be the output when the code is executed?
Which of the following statements about interfaces in C# is TRUE?
options: A class can implement only one interface
Interfaces can have default implementations starting from C# 8.0
Interface members are private by default

questions.question: What is encapsulation in OOP?
options: The ability of objects to take many forms
Bundling data and methods that operate on that data within a single unit
Creating new classes from existing ones
Hiding the complexity of the system

questions.question: In an ASP.NET Core Web API with the following controller, which action handles GET /api/products/123?
What is the correct HTTP method mapping for RESTful controller actions?
options: Retrieve - HttpPost, Create - HttpGet, Update - HttpDelete, Remove - HttpPut
Retrieve - HttpGet, Create - HttpPost, Update - HttpPut, Remove - HttpDelete
Retrieve - HttpPut, Create - HttpPost, Update - HttpGet, Remove - HttpDelete
Retrieve - HttpDelete, Create - HttpGet, Update - HttpPut, Remove - HttpPost

questions.question: What is Dependency Injection in ASP.NET Core?
options: A way to inject SQL queries into the database
A design pattern for achieving Inversion of Control between classes and their dependencies
A method to inject JavaScript into web pages
A technique to inject environment variables

questions.question: Which service lifetime in ASP.NET Core DI creates a new instance for every request?
What does middleware do in ASP.NET Core?
options: Handles requests and responses in the pipeline

questions.question: Which LINQ method should you use to filter products with price greater than a specified value?
What is a DbContext in Entity Framework Core?
options: A session with the database that allows querying and saving data

questions.question: What does the Include() method do in Entity Framework Core?
options: Includes a new table in the database
Includes a new column in a table

questions.question: Which approach in Entity Framework Core allows you to define the database schema using C# classes?
What is lazy loading in Entity Framework Core?
options: Loading related entities only when they are accessed

questions.question: In a query with INNER JOIN between Users and Projects tables, how many table scans are performed at minimum?
questions.code:
SELECT U.FirstName 
FROM Users U 
INNER JOIN Projects P ON U.Id = P.CreatedBy 
WHERE U.Email <> @email AND P.Id = @projectId

questions.question: What is the difference between INNER JOIN and LEFT JOIN?
options: INNER JOIN returns only matching rows, LEFT JOIN returns all rows from left table
LEFT JOIN returns only matching rows, INNER JOIN returns all rows
INNER JOIN is faster than LEFT JOIN

questions.question: What does the UNION operator do in SQL?
options: Combines results of two queries and removes duplicates

questions.question: Which constraint ensures that a column cannot have NULL values?
What is a PRIMARY KEY in SQL?
options: A key that can have duplicate values
A unique identifier for each record in a table
A key that references another table
A key that allows NULL values

questions.question: What will be the output?
What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A way to close the browser
A function that has access to variables from its outer scope even after the outer function has returned
A method to close database connections
A way to end a loop

questions.question: What is the difference between '==' and '===' in JavaScript?
options: '==' compares with type coercion, '===' compares without type coercion

questions.question: What does 'async/await' do in JavaScript?
options: Allows writing asynchronous code in a synchronous style

questions.question: What is the output of this code?
What design pattern is used when you have an interface with multiple implementations and you select one at runtime based on conditions?
What pattern is used when wrapping an object to add new behavior without modifying the original class?
Which pattern ensures a class has only one instance and provides a global point of access to it?
What is the Repository pattern used for?
options: Abstracting data access logic from business logic

questions.question: What is Dependency Injection pattern?
options: A technique where an object receives its dependencies from external sources

questions.question: Which default delegate type does NOT exist in C#?
options: All of them exist in C#

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'yield' keyword in C#?
options: To return elements one at a time from an iterator method
To yield priority to other processes
To break out of a loop

questions.question: What will be the output of this code?
What is the difference between 'ref' and 'out' parameters?
options: 'ref' requires initialization before passing, 'out' must be assigned before method returns
'out' requires initialization before passing, 'ref' must be assigned before method returns

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'using' statement in C#?
options: To ensure proper disposal of IDisposable objects
To create aliases for types only

questions.question: What is the purpose of appsettings.json in ASP.NET Core?
options: To store configuration settings for the application

questions.question: How do you return a 404 Not Found response from an ASP.NET Core controller action?
What is a migration in Entity Framework Core?
options: Moving the database to another server
A way to incrementally update the database schema to match the data model

questions.question: What does AsNoTracking() do in Entity Framework Core?
options: Deletes tracking data from the database
Returns entities without change tracking for read-only scenarios

questions.question: What is an index in SQL?
options: A data structure that improves the speed of data retrieval

questions.question: What is the difference between DELETE and TRUNCATE?
options: DELETE can have WHERE clause and is logged, TRUNCATE removes all rows and is minimally logged
TRUNCATE can have WHERE clause, DELETE cannot

questions.question: What is an abstract class in C#?
options: A class that cannot have any methods
A class that cannot be instantiated and may contain abstract members
A class that can only have static methods
A class that must be sealed

questions.question: What is unit testing?
options: Testing individual units or components of code in isolation

questions.question: What is the AAA pattern in unit testing?
What is LINQ in C#?
options: Language Integrated Query - a query syntax for collections and data sources
